entries.content: Be good at listening and asking a ton of questions to understand the customer's perspective and situation.
Challenge the customer confidently to unearth their real pain points and the root causes of their business challenges.
entries.notes: Challenging makes them think differently and reveals underlying issues.

entries.content: Focus on the discovery phase: getting to the bottom of the challenge and really unearthing the issues.
entries.notes: This is crucial for understanding the customer's needs and potential objections.

entries.content: Ask 'why' questions to understand the reasons behind current processes or challenges, rather than just accepting 'it works'.
entries.notes: Understanding the 'why' helps identify root causes and areas for improvement.

entries.content: Earn the right to be in front of senior decision-makers by demonstrating value and the ability to challenge their thinking.
entries.notes: This allows for deeper, more revealing discovery conversations.
Emphasizes asking questions and listening over presenting features.

focus_area: Objection Discovery: Clarifying questions, isolation, root cause
